sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"地区"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: district, region, area, section, zone, belt, quarter, neighbourhood
means: district ： 多指由政府等机构出于行政管理等目的而明确划分的地区。
region ： 普通用词，常指地球上、大气中具有自然分界线的区域，特指按照气候、人体或其他特征鲜明、自成一体的地区。
area ： 普通用词，指整体中较大的，界线不分明的一部分。
section ： 普通用词，指城市、国家或天然界线形成的地区。
zone ： 科技用词，指圆形或弧形地带，尤指地图上按温度划分的五个地带。用作一般意义时，也可指具有某种特征的其它地区。
belt ： 从本义"带，带状物"引申而指任何广阔的长条地带，也可指种植某种作物的地区。
quarter ： 指城市里具有相同性质或独特风味的地区，比section范围小，但划分更精确。
neighbourhood ： 指比section的划定更清楚，范围更小。具体指城市中的住宅区，也可指附近一带。

word_mean: 倾斜长壁分带开采的采区又称“带区(strip district)”。

sentence.Network_en: The District Council made a weekly collection of refuse.
sentence.Network_cn: 区政务委员会每周收取一次垃圾。

sentence.Network_en: The district council agreed with the objectors and turned down the application.
sentence.Network_cn: 区政务委员会同意反对者的意见，拒绝了这一申请。

sentence.Network_en: The defense wants the district Judge to throw out the case.
sentence.Network_cn: 辩护律师希望区法官不受理那个案子。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (denoting the territory under the jurisdiction of a feudal lord): from French, from medieval Latin districtus ('territory of) jurisdiction', from Latin distringere 'draw apart'

entry.def: A district is a particular area of a town or country.

example.ex: I drove around the business district.
example.tran: 我开车在商业区转了转。

entry.def: A district is an area of a town or country which has been given official boundaries for the purpose of administration.

example.ex: ...the home of the governor of the district.
...the continuing support of Glasgow District Council.
example.tran: 格拉斯哥行政区政务委员会一直以来给予的支持

means.word_mean: 1. a region marked off for administrative or other purposes
1. regulate housing in; of certain areas of towns

auth_sentence.content: The district of Lhoknga was flattened by the waves.
auth_sentence.res_content: The district of Lhoknga was flattened by the waves.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The district of Lhoknga was flattened by the waves.

auth_sentence.content: Was this the coast of the English Lake District?
auth_sentence.res_content: Was this the coast of the English Lake District?

auth_sentence.content: Our district secretary for Headlands was kidnapped this morning.
auth_sentence.res_content: Our district secretary for Headlands was kidnapped this morning.

stems_affixes.value_cn: [with]严格的,严厉的;严谨的,精确的
stems_affixes.word_buile: strict拉紧→adj.[with]严格的,严厉的;严谨的,精确的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 区域, 地方, 管区, 行政区
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis分开+strict拉紧→分开拉,分开管理→分区;区域, 地方
restrict[v.限制,约束]+ion表名词→n.限制,限定,约束
strict[adj.[with]严格的,严厉的;严谨的,精确的]+ure表名词→n.谴责,严厉,束缚

Sentence.sentence: Districts all over the country are taking notice, along with mayors in cities like New York, Chicago and San Diego.
As the new sales director for a national computer firm, Alex Gordon was looking forward to his first meeting with the company's district managers.
When Andrea found a job with a school district closer to her mother's home in West Jordan, Utah, the family decided to move on.

sentences.en: A number of unruly youths ganged up and terrorized the district.
sentences.cn: 一些不法青年结成一伙, 使这个地区陷于恐怖。

means.word_mean: (为行政、司法、选举、教育等目的而划分的国家、州或县的)区，行政区，管(辖)区

sentences.en: They divide the city into sections, each district having its own streets or blocks.
sentences.cn: 他们把这个城市分成若干个区, 每个区都有自己的街道或街区。

sentences.en: to district the city into three election districts.
sentences.cn: 把该市划分成三个选区

jushi.english: A number of unruly youths ganged up and terrorized the district.
jushi.chinese: 一些不法青年结成一伙,使这个地区充满恐怖。

jushi.english: Haikou is divided into three districts.
The Lili's have been looking around the western district for a house at a suitable price.
jushi.chinese: 李利夫妇一直想在西区寻找一套价格合适的房子。
